title: 105_s1794
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gulf War Veterans' Iraqi Claims Protection Act of 1998". Adjudication of claims is addressed in the Act. The United States Commission is authorized to receive and determine claims by U.S. nationals against Iraq, applying applicable law and principles of justice. Priority is given to non-commercial claims before other claims are decided. The United States Commission prioritizes non-commercial claims by U.S. nationals related to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait and the attack on the USS Stark before other claims. The Commission applies relevant law and principles of justice and equity in making decisions. The United States Commission prioritizes non-commercial claims by U.S. nationals related to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait and the 1987 attack on the USS Stark. The International Claims Settlement Act of 1949 provisions apply to claims under this Act. SEC. 3. CLAIMS FUNDS. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to establish the Iraq Claims Fund for payment of claims. Proceeds from Iraqi asset liquidation will be allocated by the President between the Iraq Claims Fund and other appropriate accounts. The President will allocate funds from asset liquidation between the Iraq Claims Fund and other accounts for US Government claims, with a limitation on the amount allocated. The subsection limits the payment of claims of the United States Government to a specific amount based on certified claims outside the jurisdiction of the United Nations Commission. The Secretary of State determines claims of the US Government outside the UN Commission's jurisdiction, certifies their validity and amount under procedures set by the President. The President is authorized to vest and liquidate Iraqi assets in the US to satisfy claims under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. Additionally, the Secretary of State certifies and determines US Government claims outside the UN Commission's jurisdiction. SEC. 5. REIMBURSEMENT FOR ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. The Secretary of the Treasury deducts 1.5 percent of funds into the Iraq Claims Fund for government expenses. Amounts deducted are treated as miscellaneous receipts in the Treasury. The United States Commission certifies awards to the Secretary of the Treasury for payment from the Iraq Claims Fund in order of priority. Payment includes $10,000 or the award's principal amount, additional $90,000 for certain claims, and periodic payments towards unpaid balances. The United States Commission certifies awards to the Secretary of the Treasury for payment from the Iraq Claims Fund in order of priority. Payments include $10,000 or the award's principal amount, an additional $90,000 for certain claims, and periodic payments towards unpaid balances. Payments are made in ratable proportions based on the total amount available in the fund. Interest payments are made after the principal amounts of all awards have been paid in full. After full payment of awards from the Iraq Claims Fund, any remaining funds will be transferred to the US Treasury. Payment of awards does not extinguish unsatisfied claims against the Government of Iraq. Payment of awards under this Act will not extinguish any unsatisfied claims against the Government of Iraq. SEC. 7. The head of any Executive agency may transfer records to the United States Commission for claims adjudication. SEC. 8. Statute of limitations and disposition of unused funds. Statute of Limitations: Any demand for payment on certified awards under this Act is barred one year after the notice publication. The Secretary of the Treasury must publish a notice in the Federal Register after 9 years, detailing the statute of limitations and identifying unpaid claims. The Secretary of the Treasury must publish a notice in the Federal Register after 9 years, detailing the statute of limitations and identifying unpaid claims. After 2 years from the publication date, any unused funds will be deposited into the Treasury. At the end of a 2-year period from the notice publication, the Secretary of the Treasury will dispose of any unused funds from the Iraq Claims Fund by depositing them into the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts. SEC. 9. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, definitions include the meaning of "Executive agency," "Government of Iraq," "United Nations Commission," and "United States Commission." The United Nations Compensation Commission and the United States Commission are defined in this Act.
